page.title: 02The Rural Landscape
page.content: Our rectangle is rural. The land is mostly covered by grass with some crops e.g.Barley and Wheat.Many of the fields are used for grazing and for silage.The farms in our area are dairy farms.The largest centre of population in our area is Tregadillet though not all of this village is in our area.The other settlements are Langore and Truscott.There is a lot of woodland in our area.The largest wood is Trebusey.At Rings Wood there is an Iron Age Fort.There is also a disused railway in our rectangle which the enthusiasts hope to restore.The railway tends to run beside the River Kensey.The River Kensey runs from east to west across our rectangle and the hills run from north to south.
